edu.wm.cs.cs301.slidingpuzzle

Class SimplePuzzleStateBasicsTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wm.cs.cs301.slidingpuzzle.SimplePuzzleStateBasicsTest

  • public class SimplePuzzleStateBasicsTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Junit test cases for SimplePuzzleState implementation of PuzzleState interface. Class contains a number of black box tests. Tests are very basic in that they rely on as little extra functionality as possible aside from the method under test. This implies that tests are not particularly elaborate and may serve as a set of initial smoke tests to see if at least some basic functionality is there.

    • Method Detail

      • testSetToInitialStateIntIntOneSlot

        public final void testSetToInitialStateIntIntOneSlot()
        Test method for PuzzleState.setToInitialState(int, int). The initial state for a given dimension and number of empty slots should list tiles with numbers in increasing order and have empty slots at the very end. Empty slots are encoded with zero values. We test if this works for 1 empty slot. Test requires setToInitialState() and getValue() being properly implemented.

      • testSetToInitialStateIntIntSeveralSlots

        public final void testSetToInitialStateIntIntSeveralSlots()
        Test method for PuzzleState.setToInitialState(int, int). The initial state for a given dimension and number of empty slots should list tiles with numbers in increasing order and have empty slots at the very end. Empty slots are encoded with zero values. We test if this works for several empty slots. Test requires setToInitialState() and getValue() being properly implemented.

      • testHashCode

        public final void testHashCode()
        Test method for Object.hashCode(). The SimplePuzzleState class must implement (override) the equals method. If one does so, it is recommended good practice to also override the hashCode method to have a consistent class design. We check if equal states receive the same hashCode. Test requires setToInitialState() and hashCode() being properly implemented.

      • testEqualsObject

        public final void testEqualsObject()
        Test method for Object.equals(java.lang.Object). The SimplePuzzleState class must implement (override) the equals method. Test requires setToInitialState() and equals() being properly implemented.

      • testGetOperation

        public final void testGetOperation()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getOperation(). Trivial test to see if initial state returns null for the operation. Test requires getOperation() being properly implemented.

      • testGetOperation1

        public final void testGetOperation1()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getOperation(). Test to see if direct successor state returns correct operation. Test requires getOperation() and move() being properly implemented.

      • testGetParent

        public final void testGetParent()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getParent(). Trivial test to see if initial state returns null for the parent node. Test requires getParent() being properly implemented.

      • testGetParent1

        public final void testGetParent1()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getParent(). Test to see if direct successor state returns the initial state as its parent. Test requires getParent(), equals() and move() being properly implemented.

      • testGetPathLength

        public final void testGetPathLength()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getPathLength(). Test to see if the path length for the initial state is 0. Test requires getPathLength() being properly implemented.

      • testGetPathLength1

        public final void testGetPathLength1()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getPathLength(). Test to see if the path length for a successor state of the initial state is 1. Test requires getPathLength() and move() being properly implemented.

      • testShuffleBoard

        public final void testShuffleBoard()
        Test method for PuzzleState.shuffleBoard(int). Trivial test to see if shuffleBoard returns an equal state for length 0 and different states for length greater 0. Test requires setToInitialState(), equals(), and shuffleBoard() being properly implemented.

      • testGetValue

        public final void testGetValue()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getValue(int,int). Trivial test to see if shuffleBoard returns states where the sum of values across all tiles stays the same. Test uses getValue() extensively but only checks correctness with the help of an aggregate (sum). Test requires setToInitialState(), shuffleBoard() and getValue() being properly implemented.

      • testMove

        public final void testMove()
        Test method for PuzzleState.move(int,int,Operation). Test to see if a move operation works. We try two different directions for the same empty slot. We also check that the starting state remains intact. Test requires setToInitialState(), isEmpty(), equals() and move() being properly implemented.

      • testDrag

        public final void testDrag()
        Test method for PuzzleState.drag(int,int,int,int). Test to see if a drag operation works. We try two different directions for the same empty slot. We also check that the starting state remains intact. Test requires setToInitialState(), isEmpty(), equals() and drag() being properly implemented.

      • testIsEmpty

        public final void testIsEmpty()
        Test method for PuzzleState.isEmpty(int,int). Test checks all positions on the initial state for being empty or not. Test requires setToInitialState() and isEmpty() being properly implemented.

      • testGetStateWithShortestPath

        public final void testGetStateWithShortestPath()
        Test method for PuzzleState.getStateWithShortestPath(). Trivial test to see if getStateWithShortestPath() returns a state for trivial sequences of length 0 and 1. Test is not(!) rigid enough to see if an existing cycle is recognized and removed by the method. Test requires setToInitialState() and isEmpty() being properly implemented.
